20150728 - Find Degree of Angle in a Square

Jul 28, 2015 â€¢ ev3commander

In square ABCD, let E and F be points on BC and CD respectively, and BE=1, EF=4, FD=3. Find the measure of $\angle$EAF in degrees.

Solution

Extend line segment CD to point G, let DG = 1. By construction $\triangle$ABE $\cong$ $\triangle$ADG, then line AG = AE, and EF = 4 = (GD + DF) = GF, so $\triangle$AGF $\cong$ $\triangle$AEF.
Also $\angle$BAE = $\angle$DAG, and $\angle$BAD = 90°, so $\angle$EAG = 90°.
Then we know $\angle$EAF = $\frac{1}{2}\angle$EAG = 45°.
